RL_GNN.fit_status: FAILED - error rates INCREASE with distance (wrong direction)
RL_GNN.fit_note: Cannot fit exponential decay when error rates increase. System is NOT in error correction regime - operating above threshold.

extrapolation_d21.note: Cannot extrapolate when error rates diverge. If trend continues, L(d=21) would exceed 60% (random guessing)

RL_GNN.conclusion: RL_GNN does NOT exhibit quantum error suppression. Performance degrades with distance, opposite of required behavior.

MWPM.fit_status: FAILED - error rates INCREASE then plateau
MWPM.fit_note: MWPM also fails to achieve error suppression. System operating at/above error threshold p_th.

extrapolation_d21.note: MWPM appears to plateau around 48-50%, suggesting system at threshold

MWPM.conclusion: MWPM also fails to suppress errors. Both decoders operating above effective threshold.

comparison.interpretation: Critical finding: System is NOT in quantum error correction regime. Physical error rate p=0.005 appears to be above the effective threshold for both classical (MWPM) and RL-based decoders. True QEC requires exponential suppression (Lambda > 1), but observed Lambda < 1 at most distances, indicating error amplification rather than correction.

possible_explanations: Noise model mismatch between theory and simulation
Measurement errors not properly accounted for
Effective noise rate higher than nominal p=0.005

generalization_hypothesis.hypothesis: RL trained on d=7 generalizes to d=15 with <15% degradation
generalization_hypothesis.conclusion: Generalization gap of 94% far exceeds 15% threshold. RL does not learn transferable QEC principles.
generalization_hypothesis.interpretation: Model appears to overfit to specific distance rather than learning general syndrome-to-correction mapping.

scaling_analysis.critical_failure: System not performing quantum error correction
recommendation: Verify MWPM implementation against PyMatching reference
Check syndrome generation with Stim simulator
Validate that physical error rate p=0.005 is correctly applied
Consider lower p (e.g., 0.001-0.003) to ensure below-threshold operation
Review measurement error model and gate fidelity assumptions

distance_vs_error.plot_title: Logical Error Rate vs Code Distance
distance_vs_error.observed_behavior: Increasing then plateauing - system above threshold

improvement_vs_distance.plot_title: RL Improvement Over MWPM vs Distance
improvement_vs_distance.interpretation: Sharp degradation beyond d=7, failure at d=15
